N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 146.1 - Reimbursements

State Regulations
(a) In accordance
with the provisions of section 11 of chapter 853 of the Laws of 1976, each
county or other political subdivision which had, prior to July 1, 1976, been
charged for the cost of tuition and transportation for handicapped children
pursuant to section
232
or
234
of the

Family Court Act shall reimburse the State for its payment of such costs, as
provided in this section. (b) The
amount of such reimbursement will be determined by the Commissioner of

Education, who shall multiply the sum paid by each county or other political
subdivision for such purpose during the period July 1, 1975 through June 30, 1976, less the amount of State aid due and payable pursuant to the former
section
4403
of the

Education Law for such costs, by the applicable percentage set forth in section
11 of chapter 853 of the Laws of 1976. The commissioner shall also prescribe
the format and procedure for payment. (c) Except as provided in subdivision (e) of
this section, the Commissioner of Education shall notify each county or other
political subdivision of the amount of such reimbursement by no later than June
1 of each year. The commissioner shall transmit to the Comptroller a copy of
the billing sent to each county or other political subdivision. Except as
provided by subdivision (e) of this section, reimbursement shall be made in
equal quarterly installments on July 1, October 1, January 1 and April 1 of
each year. Each county or other political subdivision shall make the
appropriate reimbursement directly to the Comptroller. (d) For the period July 1, 1976 through June
30, 1977, the amount of reimbursement shall be based upon orders of the Family

Court which have been approved by the Commissioner of Education and the

Comptroller for State aid purposes, as of November 15, 1976, subject to
adjustment if additional claims for State aid for services provided during the
1975-76 school year are received after such date. In subsequent years, adjustments to prior billings caused by changes in the base will be made prior
to July 1 of each year, and shall be paid in equal installments as set forth in
subdivision (c) of this section. (e) For the period July 1, 1976 through June
30, 1977, the Commissioner of Education shall notify, by December 1, 1976, each
county or other political subdivision of the amount of its reimbursement to the

State. Reimbursement shall be made in one payment to the Comptroller by no
later than January 15, 1977. Notes
